	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

>While performing Incremental Crawling, it seems like Heritrix checks
>the =
current queue, if a document has already been fetched (by checking
>its con=
tent hash) but does not check if the same document has been
>fetched from a=
nother website.  
 
That is correct. The AR stuff does not detect mirrors n=
or was it intended to
do that.
 
>
>How should this be handled in the clust=
ered version (multiple machines
>running Heritrix)?  
 
Running Heritrix on=
 multiple machines that cooperate in some way is not
supported at the momen=
t. Typically multi machine crawls are done by
segmenting the crawl scope. A=
ny given URI would only be crawled by a single
machine therefor no need to =
worry about it. If it did mirror detection, then
it would become an issue, =
but since it doesn't ...
 
>
>For example: Some mirror sites usually have t=
he same content but
>different urls.
>
>These URLs would be waiting in diff=
erent queues. 
>
>Each queue will first fetch a document.
>
>Then, create a=
 hash of their contents and check the value against the
>saved hash values =
in CrawlURI objects only in their respective queues.
>It doesnt check if th=
e other queues already contain a CrawlURI object
>with the same hashvalue.
=
>
>  
>So, how should this be handled ?  
 
Like I've said, mirror detectio=
n isn't available. If you want to add it,
feel free. It would require index=
ing by the hash content (probably in a
seperate DB to avoid having to check=
 each queue). It would undoubtedly incur
a significant I/O overhead, which =
is one of the reasons it isn't in already.
 
- Kris
 
>
>With regards,
>Sha=
dab
>
>
>
>
